weatherForecast.comment: On Thursday, frequent sunshine to start with, excellent visibility. In the afternoon, clouds will move in. Winds will be light to moderate from N/E directions, from the south on the Main Alpine Ridge. At 2000m: -2 to -4 degrees in afternoon; at 3000m: -7 degrees.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Assess steep shady slopes with caution
avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger above 2000m is moderate, below that altitude danger is low. Avalanches can in some places be triggered even by one sole skier. Avalanches can fracture down to more deeply embedded layers in the snowpack, particularly on steep north-facing slopes, and grow to medium size.  In addition, some ridgeline locations can trigger near surface layers on wind-loaded slopes, releases mostly small. Small glide-snow avalanches are possible.

snowpackStructure.comment: Inside the old snowpack on very steep shady slopes there are weak layers of faceted crystals. On the one hand, the snow was able to metamorphose esp. where snow is shallow; on the other, below the near-surface melt-freeze crust there are also faceted crystals. Snowdrifts can form a slab on the surface above the faceted crystals. On shady slopes loose snow is still evident, on sunny slopes it is turning to firn.

tendency.highlights: Persistent weak layer problem will gradually recede as snowpack settles

weatherForecast.comment: In the Prealps, cloudy in the morning, minor snowfall is possible. Visibliity is limited only in isolated cases at high altitudes. Further to the south, more sunshine and good visibility. In afternoon, clouds will move in. Winds will be light to moderate from N/E directions. At 2000m: -2 to -4 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is low. Triggering a small slab (most likely above 2000m on shady very steep slopes) is possible in a few places. In isolated cases a small glide-snow avalanche is possible.

snowpackStructure.comment: The fundament is weak (faceted crystals beneath crusts) but fracture propagation is unlikely (lacking slab). On shady slopes there is loose snow, on sunny slopes firn conditions are developing.

customData.generalHeadline: Moderate persistent weak layer problem in places on steep shady slopes
